metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4437 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Apache Shiro before 1.2.5, when a cipher key has not been configured forthe "remember me" feature, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrarycode or bypass intended access restrictions via an unspecified requestparameter.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libshiro-java - 1.3.2-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: shiro package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2-2').
